column2: He knew the question of Owen's marriage was soon to be raised, and the abrupt alteration in the young man's mood made it seem probable that he was himself the centre of the atmospheric disturbance, For a moment it occurred to Darrow that Anna might have employed her afternoon in preparing Madame de Chantelle for her grandson's impending announcement; but a glance at the elder lady's unclouded brow showed that he must seek elsewhere the clue to Owen's taciturnity and his step-mother's concern. Possibly Anna had found reason to change her own attitude in the matter, and had made the change known to Owen.

column2: And she believes you--she completely believes you?

column2: He uttered a protesting exclamation, and his flush reflected itself in the girl's cheek.
column3: He uttered a protesting exclamation, and his flush reflected itself in the girl's cheek.

column2: Oh, I beg your pardon!	Oh, I beg your pardon!
column3: true

column2: I didn't mean to ask you that." She halted, and again cast a rapid glance behind and ahead of her.
column3: I didn't mean to ask you that." She halted, and again cast a rapid glance behind and ahead of her.

column2: Then she held out her hand.
column3: Then she held out her hand.

column2: Well, then, thank you--and let me relieve your fears.	Well, then, thank you-and let me relieve your fears.
column3: true

column2: I sha'n't be Effie's governess much longer."
column3: I sha'n't be Effie's governess much longer."

column2: At the announcement, Darrow tried to merge his look of relief into the expression of friendly interest with which he grasped her hand.
column3: At the announcement, Darrow tried to merge his look of relief into the expression of friendly interest with which he grasped her hand.

column2: You really do agree with me, then?	You really do agree with me, then?
column3: true

column2: And you'll give me a chance to talk things over with you?"
column3: And you'll give me a chance to talk things over with you?"

column2: She shook her head with a faint smile.
column3: She shook her head with a faint smile.

column2: I'm not thinking of the stage. I've had another offer: that's all.
column3: I'm not thinking of the stage. I've had another offer: that's all.

column2: The relief was hardly less great.
column3: The relief was hardly less great.

column2: After all, his personal responsibility ceased with her departure from Givre.
column3: After all, his personal responsibility ceased with her departure from Givre.

column2: You'll tell me about that, then--won't you?
column3: You'll tell me about that, then-won't you?

column2: Her smile flickered up.
column3: Her smile flickered up.

column2: Oh, you'll hear about it soon...I must catch Effie now and drag her back to the blackboard.
column3: Oh, you'll hear about it soon...I must catch Effie now and drag her back to the blackboard.

column2: She walked on for a few yards, and then paused again and confronted him. "I've been odious to you--and not quite honest," she broke out suddenly.
column3: She walked on for a few yards, and then paused again and confronted him. "I've been odious to you-and not quite honest," she broke out suddenly.

column2: Not quite honest? he repeated, caught in a fresh wave of wonder.
column3: Not quite honest? he repeated, caught in a fresh wave of wonder.

column2: I mean, in seeming not to trust you.	I mean, in seeming not to trust you.
column3: true

column2: It's come over me again as we talked that, at heart, I've always KNOWN I could..."
column3: It's come over me again as we talked that, at heart, I've always KNOWN I could..."

column2: Her colour rose in a bright wave, and her eyes clung to his for a swift instant of reminder and appeal.
column3: Her colour rose in a bright wave, and her eyes clung to his for a swift instant of reminder and appeal.

column2: For the same space of time the past surged up in him confusedly; then a veil dropped between them.
column3: For the same space of time the past surged up in him confusedly; then a veil dropped between them.

column2: Here's Effie now! she exclaimed.
column3: Here's Effie now! she exclaimed.

column2: He turned and saw the little girl trotting back to them, her hand in Owen Leath's.
column3: He turned and saw the little girl trotting back to them, her hand in Owen Leath's.

column2: Even through the stir of his subsiding excitement Darrow was at once aware of the change effected by the young man's approach. For a moment Sophy Viner's cheeks burned redder; then they faded to the paleness of white petals.
column3: Even through the stir of his subsiding excitement Darrow was at once aware of the change effected by the young man's approach. For a moment Sophy Viner's cheeks burned redder; then they faded to the paleness of white petals.

column2: She lost, however, nothing of the bright bravery which it was her way to turn on the unexpected.
column3: She lost, however, nothing of the bright bravery which it was her way to turn on the unexpected.

column2: Perhaps no one less familiar with her face than Darrow would have discerned the tension of the smile she transferred from himself to Owen Leath, or have remarked that her eyes had hardened from misty grey to a shining darkness.
column3: Perhaps no one less familiar with her face than Darrow would have discerned the tension of the smile she transferred from himself to Owen Leath, or have remarked that her eyes had hardened from misty grey to a shining darkness.

column2: But her observer was less struck by this than by the corresponding change in Owen Leath.
column3: But her observer was less struck by this than by the corresponding change in Owen Leath.

column2: The latter, when he came in sight, had been laughing and talking unconcernedly with Effie; but as his eye fell on Miss Viner his expression altered as suddenly as hers.
column3: The latter, when he came in sight, had been laughing and talking unconcernedly with Effie; but as his eye fell on Miss Viner his expression altered as suddenly as hers.

column2: The change, for Darrow, was less definable; but, perhaps for that reason, it struck him as more sharply significant.
column3: The change, for Darrow, was less definable; but, perhaps for that reason, it struck him as more sharply significant.

column2: Only--just what did it signify?
column3: Only-just what did it signify?

column2: Owen, like Sophy Viner, had the kind of face which seems less the stage on which emotions move than the very stuff they work in.
column3: Owen, like Sophy Viner, had the kind of face which seems less the stage on which emotions move than the very stuff they work in.

column2: In moments of excitement his odd irregular features seemed to grow fluid, to unmake and remake themselves like the shadows of clouds on a stream.
column3: In moments of excitement his odd irregular features seemed to grow fluid, to unmake and remake themselves like the shadows of clouds on a stream.

column2: Darrow, through the rapid flight of the shadows, could not seize on any specific indication of feeling: he merely perceived that the young man was unaccountably surprised at finding him with Miss Viner, and that the extent of his surprise might cover all manner of implications.
column3: Darrow, through the rapid flight of the shadows, could not seize on any specific indication of feeling: he merely perceived that the young man was unaccountably surprised at finding him with Miss Viner, and that the extent of his surprise might cover all manner of implications.

column2: Darrow's first idea was that Owen, if he suspected that the conversation was not the result of an accidental encounter, might wonder at his step-mother's suitor being engaged, at such an hour, in private talk with her little girl's governess.
column3: Darrow's first idea was that Owen, if he suspected that the conversation was not the result of an accidental encounter, might wonder at his step mother's suitor being engaged, at such an hour, in private talk with her little girl's governess.

column2: The thought was so disturbing that, as the three turned back to the house, he was on the point of saying to Owen: "I came out to look for your mother." But, in the contingency he feared, even so simple a phrase might seem like an awkward attempt at explanation; and he walked on in silence at Miss Viner's side.
column3: The thought was so disturbing that, as the three turned back to the house, he was on the point of saying to Owen: "I came out to look for your mother." But, in the contingency he feared, even so simple a phrase might seem like an awkward attempt at explanation; and he walked on in silence at Miss Viner's side.

column2: Presently he was struck by the fact that Owen Leath and the girl were silent also; and this gave a new turn to his thoughts.
column3: Presently he was struck by the fact that Owen Leath and the girl were silent also; and this gave a new turn to his thoughts.

column2: Silence may be as variously shaded as speech; and that which enfolded Darrow and his two companions seemed to his watchful perceptions to be quivering with cross-threads of communication.
column3: Silence may be as variously shaded as speech; and that which enfolded Darrow and his two companions seemed to his watchful perceptions to be quivering with cross threads of communication.

column2: At first he was aware only of those that centred in his own troubled consciousness; then it occurred to him that an equal activity of intercourse was going on outside of it.
column3: At first he was aware only of those that centred in his own troubled consciousness; then it occurred to him that an equal activity of intercourse was going on outside of it.

column2: Something was in fact passing mutely and rapidly between young Leath and Sophy Viner; but what it was, and whither it tended, Darrow, when they reached the house, was but just beginning to divine...
column3: Something was in fact passing mutely and rapidly between young Leath and Sophy Viner; but what it was, and whither it tended, Darrow, when they reached the house, was but just beginning to divine...
